translations.aboutGakusei.aboutGakusei.p: Gakusei is a web application where you can practice Japanese. The application has four game modes:
translations.aboutGakusei.aboutGakusei.li1: "Guess" the word that can be found under "words". Here you should choose the correct translation of one word among four options.
translations.aboutGakusei.aboutGakusei.li2: "Flashcard" can be found under the "words" tab. Here"s the question of guessing one word. Did you guess right?
translations.aboutGakusei.aboutGakusei.li3: "Quiz" Here you can play questions related to JapanHere you can play questions related to Japan.
translations.aboutGakusei.aboutGakusei.li4: "Kanji" Here you can test your skills in Kanji.
translations.aboutGakusei.rights.p2: All rights to the program code are owned by Kokitotsos AB. This site is operated by Daigaku Sweden and licensed Gakusei by Kokitotsos AB through an open source license. Educational materials have been compiled by Pierre Sandboge, and include own material and other material shown elsewhere on this page.
translations.aboutGakusei.rights.p3: operated without employees, with donated funds, and no guarantee of availability can be given. The provision of the service may terminate at any time without notice.
translations.aboutGakusei.licenses.p: The Gakusei web site is under license
translations.aboutGakusei.licenses.p2: Below is a list of licenses for the modules that the project uses.
translations.aboutGakusei.infoBanner.contributors.p3: See who contributed to the project
translations.aboutGakusei.infoBanner.owner.p: All rights to the program code are owned by Kokitotsos AB.
translations.aboutGakusei.finishScreen.question: Question
translations.homeScreen.gameNav: Navigate to game types in the menu to add lessons.
translations.loginScreen.p1: We do not save any personal data so be sure to remember your password. We have no way of resetting it for you.
translations.loginScreen.login.wrongTasks: Incorrect information, please check the form.
translations.loginScreen.login.lettersAndNumbers: The username must contain only letters and numbers.
translations.loginScreen.login.username-2-32: The username must be between 2 and 32 characters.
translations.loginScreen.login.password-2-100: The password must be between 2 and 100 characters.
translations.loginScreen.login.passwordNoSpace: The password may not contain spaces.
translations.selectScreen.pageDescription.quiz: Put your knowledge of Japan to the test by choosing one of four alternatives
translations.selectScreen.pageDescription.guess: Choose the correct alternative out of four choices.
translations.selectScreen.pageDescription.flashcards: Practice by using cards. The question is on one side and the correct answer on the other.
translations.selectScreen.pageDescription.kanji: Practice writing kanji using correct strokes in the right order.
translations.selectScreen.pageDescription.grammar: Write the correct tense of the verb.
translations.selectScreen.getLessons.tooltopRed: Answered questions that need to be repeated
translations.selectScreen.getLessons.panel.mixedFavLe: Mixed questions from all your favorite marked lessons.
translations.selectScreen.getLessons.panel.failedQues: Here are all the questions you have answered incorrectly.
translations.startScreen.header.introductionTitle: Become a student and learn Japanese!
translations.startScreen.jumbotronBanner.colOne.h2: Gakusei offers many features that facilitate your learning
translations.startScreen.aboutFeatureImage.colTwo.p: Different types of exercises, adapted to Japanese education at university level.
translations.startScreen.aboutFeatureImage.colThree.p: Practice with Gakusei on your mobile! Works equally on mobile devices like on laptops
translations.startScreen.aboutFeatureImage.colFour.p: Gakusei stores no personal data about its users, all that is required is a username.
translations.startScreen.aboutFeatureImage.colFive.p: Try our quizzes and see what you know about Japan.
translations.startScreen.aboutFeatureImage.colSix.p: Our system remembers how you answered questions, so we can customize the learning material for you.
translations.startScreen.jumbotronBannerDaigaku.p: Daigaku Sweden aims to promote teaching and research in Japanese. Today, to a large extent, Japanese must be learned through English. We think it would be an advantage if at least some learning can be done directly from Swedish to Japanese. Therefore we have created Gakusei, the first web application that teaches Japanese through Swedish!
